sentence: Hagari  spoke  a  few  hours  after  Israel  announced  that  a  senior  Hamas  leader,  Saleh  al-Arouri,  had  been  killed  in  an  explosion  in  Beirut.
Arouri,  the  deputy  head  of  Hamas'  Lebanon-based  political  bureau,  was  the  senior-most  leader  of  the  Islamist  militant  group  killed  since  the  war  began.
The  conflict  has  been  ongoing  since  Oct.  7,  when  Hamas  militants  breached  the  Gaza  border,  killing  about  1,200  people  and  taking  about  240  hostage,  Israel  says.
More  than  22,000    Palestinians,  mostly  women  and  children,  have  been  killed  in  12  weeks  of  fighting,  Gaza's  health  ministry  says.
